intro: Lophostylis oblongifolia, commonly known as the broad-leafed lophostylis, is a flowering plant native to the island of Tonga in the South Pacific. It is a shrub or small tree characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a waxy cuticle. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically yellow or greenish-yellow, arranged in clusters. It thrives in coastal environments and is adapted to saline and well-drained soils. Lophostylis oblongifolia is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in its native habitat.
